body.p: Allow me to thank you for your letter of yesterday’s date.

The lime treesCD wished to plant a row of lime-trees on the side of the high-road along the whole wall-frontage of his property. See Pilgrim Letters 11, p. 240; dated 4 September 1866. will probably be planted about a month hence. I will take care that Mr LangfordPerhaps George Langford, of 17 Edwin St, Gravesend, acting on behalf of the Magistrates. has good notice of my gardener’s being ready for the work.

signed.persName: CHARLES DICKENS,Messrs. Essell Knight and Arnold.
